uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.content

Class HtmlBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.content.AbstractXMLBuilder
      • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.content.XMLPrinter
        • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.content.HtmlPrinter
          • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.content.HtmlBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContentBuilder, ExtendedXMLBuilder, SimpleXMLBuilder, XMLContentBuilder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HtmlBuilder.Panel

    public class HtmlBuilder
extends HtmlPrinter
implements XMLContentBuilder
    A HtmlPrinter that also implements ContentBuilder in terms of web based interfaces.
    See Also:
    HtmlWriter

      • getText

        public ExtendedXMLBuilder getText()
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        create a ExtendedXMLBuilder that appends its contents as XML text when the SimpleXMLBuilder.appendParent() method is called. Normally this represents a separate paragraph of text but this can be mapped onto ContentBuilder.getSpan() where this does not make sense for example where the ContentBuilder represents a heading or table cell.
        Specified by:
        getText in interface ContentBuilder
        Returns:
        ExtendedXMLBuilder

      • getSpan

        public ExtendedXMLBuilder getSpan()
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        create a ExtendedXMLBuilder that appends its contents as XML text when the SimpleXMLBuilder.appendParent() method is called. This is intended for in-line text rather than creating a paragraph.
        Specified by:
        getSpan in interface ContentBuilder
        Returns:
        ExtendedXMLBuilder

      • getHeading

        public ContentBuilder getHeading(int level)
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        create a ContentBuilder that appends its contents as a heading when the ContentBuilder.addParent() method is called. If the heading is to only contain text use the ContentBuilder.addHeading(int, String) method.
        Specified by:
        getHeading in interface ContentBuilder
        Parameters:
        level - level of heading
        Returns:
        ContentBuilder for header

      • setTableSections

        public void setTableSections(boolean value)

      • getDetails

        public final ContentBuilder getDetails(java.lang.Object summary_text)
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        get an expanding/folding section if supported This method can either return a new ContentBuilder or the current object. Once content has been added the ContentBuilder.closeDetails() method should be called on whichever object was returned which will perform any additional actions necessary. If expanded/folding sections are not supported this will map to ContentBuilder.addObject(Object) on the summary text and the current ContentBuilder will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getDetails in interface ContentBuilder
        Specified by:
        getDetails in interface XMLContentBuilder
        Returns:

      • closeDetails

        public final void closeDetails()
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        finish a section started by ContentBuilder.getDetails(Object) this may be a no-op if expended section are not supported
        Specified by:
        closeDetails in interface ContentBuilder
        Specified by:
        closeDetails in interface XMLContentBuilder

      • addScript

        public void addScript(java.lang.String script)
        Add a script element to HTML. This only works for html so classes that want to add script elements will need to check the class of the content builder.
        Parameters:
